public Command parse(String inputStr) throws DukeException {

* Constructs a new Ui object, with a new Parser and Scanner for System.in
* Prints hello message to indicate that setup is completed and Duke can receive user input.
print("Hello, I'm Duke!\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Gets the next line of input from the user.
* @return The next line of input from the user.

* Prints a message, indented and bracketed between two lines. Newlines in the message will have indents added

* Prints the error message from an exception.

* Base class for all Duke-specific exceptions.

* @param msg String describing the cause of the exception, and what the user can do to fix it.

* Exceptions which result from conditions external to Duke rendering it incapable of normal operations (e.g.
* permissions issues, application code corruption, etc.)
* Generates a DukeFatalException with the specified message and an additional hint that Duke is being exited from.
* @param msg Custom message explaining the problem which makes Duke unusable and suggesting actions to rectify it.
* Exceptions which the user may reset his data in response to.
* Generates a DukeResetException with a message asking the user if he wants to reset his data. The catch handler
* should have access to the Ui and Storage objects, ask the user if he wants to reset his data, and reset it if so.
super(msg + " You can back up the file, and/or reset it!"  + System.lineSeparator()
+ "Do you want to reset your Duke data now," + " to continue using Duke? (y/n)");
